text.text_translated:
Civilisation is when people live together in groups. They have art and rules.
Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we see signs of early human civilisation. For example, people made paintings in caves. We do not know the reason. Was it because of language?
People's brains did not suddenly get bigger. But people became smarter and their lives were not simple.
So we have a question. Did using language help their brains to change and work better? Or did their brains change first and then start to make language?

best_attempt.text_translated:
Civilisation is when people live together in groups. They have art and rules.

Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we see signs of early human civilisation. For example, people made paintings in caves. We do not know if this is because of language.

People's brains did not suddenly get bigger. But people became smarter and their lives became more complex.

So we have a question. Did using language make their brains more complex? Or did their more complex brains start to make language?
